executive_summary: Pathologists specialize in studies of fluids, tissues and organs, in addition to laboratory testing of diseases, viruses and bacteria in the body. Pathologists are exposed to factors that influence the overall healthcare sector. In recent years, the industry has been influenced by technological changes, an evolving healthcare landscape and the COVID-19 pandemic. Strong levels of demand for pathology services have buoyed revenue amid an upswing in operating costs related to equipment and insurance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pathology industry is made up of physicians who specialize in the use of laboratory testing to study, diagnose, and manage diseases. This involves the examination of human tissue and cells from both living and deceased patients. Pathologists typically work in hospitals or large outpatient facilities and play a crucial role in diagnosing and treating diseases.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Technological Changes Continue to Shift the Scope
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Pathology services have been revolutionized by technology in recent years. Digital pathology solutions have enabled advanced computer systems to digitally analyze data and traditional glass slides. These solutions have been boosted by the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in recent years. AI can assist practices with image analysis, pattern recognition and data interpretation.

Pathologists were relied upon during the pandemic for diagnostic testing and autopsies to help analyze transmission trends and profile the disease. Pathologists worked together closely using digital platforms to share information and develop solutions related to the disease. This created a surge in workload for many pathologists, boosting revenue despite a decrease in the number of establishments.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand for Diagnostic Testing Continues to Surge
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Pathologists offering diagnostic testing services will benefit from a growing focus on preventative care and early detection. Screening programs and new diagnostic technologies will continue to expand the scope of the industry. A heightened focus on preventative healthcare solutions, combined with an aging population and the rising prevalence of chronic diseases, will fuel steady growth in pathology revenue in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Workforce Shortage Will Limit Growth Potential
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While demand for pathology services is expected to climb in the coming years, the industry will struggle with a shortage of qualified physicians. A physician and nurse shortage is expected to affect the entire Healthcare sector, with medical students focusing on the highest paying medical specialties.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry study the cause of disease through the examination of bodies and body tissue.
key_trends: More patients are choosing telehealth services as a faster and more convenient alternative to in-person visits. This benefits pathology clinics by improving access to a wider range of patients.
Competition is based on reputation, price, accessibility and quality. However, there are limited substitutes for pathology services, which tempers the impact of competition.
As the US population continues to age, pathology labs will be increasingly relied upon. The healthcare sector focuses on preventative testing and diagnostics performed by pathologists.
Technological advances continue to push the boundaries. Pathology labs are able to incorporate data and methodologies that were previously not available thanks to advancements in technology.
Pathologists were heavily relied upon during the pandemic. Pathologists around the world collaborated to share biopsy results, test images and other data to help understand the disease.
Similar to the overall healthcare sector, pathologists have had to contend with the evolving healthcare landscape.
Access to skilled labor will be a key concern moving forward.

Patients Aged 45 to 64 are a Growing Segment
Patients 65 and Older are Facing Difficulties

General Pathology Represents the Bulk of the Industry
Imaging and Other Services Act as Compliments to Core Industry Functions

Laboratory Supply Wholesaling in the US

Medical Instrument & Supply Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: As people age, they are more likely to require healthcare services
demand_determinants.determinant_description: As people age, they are more likely to require healthcare services due to the rising incidence of age-related health conditions. Pathologists are often needed to assist in the diagnosis and treatment of these diseases. Therefore, as the population ages, demand for various industry services increases, promoting revenue growth.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are the largest industry expense, because of the high level of skill required. Costs for support staff, which include general administrative, accounting, information technology and maintenance employees, are also considerable.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages have slumped as a share of revenue in recent years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have slumped as a share of revenue in recent years as there has been a shortage of qualified pathologists. Many labs have responded by offering higher wages, but it has not offset this trend.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are a key cost component for labs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labs purchase a wide variety of equipment including scientific glass products, cleaning supplies and safety gear. Safety measures are especially important following the pandemic to prevent disease transmission. It is important for labs to develop links with suppliers to get the best price and ensure a steady supply of inputs. This has become more important as technological developments have increased product prices.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit buoyed by growing spending levels
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Expenditure on healthcare has continued to grow in recent years in response to rising prices and a growing focus on health. Patients are more willing to pay for diagnostic testing services and other services provided by pathologists to identify diseases early and form an effective treatment plan. Profit for this industry is similar to the overall healthcare sector. Moving forward, government policies and insurance company initiatives could influence profit.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Vital Role of Healthcare Limits Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Pathologists are vital to the healthcare sector, which insulates the industry from volatility to a degree. During the pandemic, pathologists were vital to understanding the spread of the disease and how it was evolving. With an aging population and rapid developments in testing technology, the industry will continue to benefit from strong demand for an array of testing services. Because of the variety of work done by pathologists, revenue tends to be relatively steady.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DIGITAL PATHOLOGY SOLUTIONS PROVIDE FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Pathologists can now connect online with patients and other doctors to provide testing solutions or collaborate about specific problems. This technology allowed pathologists to connect with physicians around the world during the pandemic while preventing the transmission of disease. This will also enable pathologists to connect with a wider range of clients from different locations. A pathologist with a specific specialty can connect with a patient who may not be able to find a suitable doctor in their area.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: TECHNOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENTS WILL CONTINUE TO SHAPE THE INDUSTRY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: These developments include computerized systems for electronic medical records and financial and administrative information and an extensive range of medical equipment to complete tests faster. As pathology labs continue to evolve their services based on the available technology, this will support revenue growth. These services will continue to evolve.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data tables with information such as revenue, number of enterprises, establishments, employment, wages, and value added for a particular industry over the years 2010 to 2021.
